DÃ¸mi 4: Komplementarir vinklar

DÃ¸mi 5: Pythagoreiskt samband

DÃ¸mi 4: HÃ¦dd Ã­ javnsÃ­Ã°aÃ°um trÃ½kanti
Ein javnsÃ­Ã°aÃ°ur trÃ½kantur hevur sÃ­Ã°ur 10 cm. Finna hÃ¦ddina.

DÃ¸mi 2: Finna allar vinklar

DÃ¸mi 3: Negativ cosinus

Negativur cosinus merkir, at vinkulin er stÃ¸rri enn 90Â° (stumpvinklaÃ°ur).


DÃ¸mi 4: Er trÃ½kanturin mÃ¸guligur?
GiviÃ°: \(a = 3\), \(b = 4\), \(c = 10\)
\[

\]
TÃ­ \(\cos(C) < -1\), er henda trÃ½kanturin ikki mÃ¸guligur!
TrÃ½hyrndungaroyskiÃ° er ikki hildiÃ°: \(c\) er ov stÃ³rur.

f(0) = a \cdot b^0 = a \cdot 1 = a
\]
So \(a = f(0)\).


Finna b
TÃ¡ vit vita \(a\) og eitt annaÃ° punkt \((x_1, y_1)\):
\[
y_1 = a \cdot b^{x_1}
\]
\[
b^{x_1} = \frac{y_1}{a}
\]
\[
b = \left(\frac{y_1}{a}\right)^{\frac{1}{x_1}}
\]


Finna a og b frÃ¡ tveimum punktum
GiviÃ° \((x_1, y_1)\) og \((x_2, y_2)\):
Systema: \[
y_1 = a \cdot b^{x_1}
\] \[
y_2 = a \cdot b^{x_2}
\]
Loysn: Deil annaÃ°a viÃ° fyrstu:
\[
\frac{y_2}{y_1} = b^{x_2 - x_1}
\]
\[
b = \left(\frac{y_2}{y_1}\right)^{\frac{1}{x_2 - x_1}}
\]
So finna \(a\) frÃ¡ einum av punktunum.


Alternativt: Linearisingur
Tak logaritman av bÃ¡Ã°um sÃ­Ã°um:
\[
\log(f(x)) = \log(a) + x \log(b)
\]
Hetta er linjurÃ¦ttur Ã­ \(x\) og \(\log(f(x))\).
Plotta \(x\) mÃ³ti \(\log(f(x))\) og finna linjuna.

title: ğŸ“š Minerva - Faroese Mathematics Education Platform# Minerva Classroom â€“ README
text:
A modern, responsive Quarto website for teaching mathematics in Faroese. Built with a focus on clean design, intuitive navigation, and excellent user experience.Minerva Classroom is a Quarto website template for math & science lessons, organized by year and subject. Itâ€™s based on Quarto and borrows the navigation/sidebar structure of the Network Science Notes site:contentReferenceoaicite:3. Each lesson page includes video embeds and LaTeX examples.





Quarto (latest version)2. Clone the repository:
A text editor (VS Code recommended)
Git (optional, for version control)3. Preview locally:

In the project folder, run quarto preview. This will build and serve the site locally (auto-refresh as you edit).



Run quarto render to generate the site into the docs/ folder.

Clone or download this repository5. Enable GitHub Pages:
``bashCommit and push your files, then in your GitHub repo settings enable Pages from thedocs/folder. The site will be published athttps://.github.io//` :contentReferenceoaicite:4.
git clone 
cd quarto_2_test## Adding a New Lesson

Different layouts for different pages:

page-layout: full - Wide layout (homepage, year overview pages)
page-layout: article - Standard with sidebars (lesson pages)
No layout specified - Uses default from _quarto.yml








The site uses two stylesheets that work together:
1. styles.css - Main styling (cards, layout, content) 2. minerva_theme.scss - Theme enhancements (navbar, TOC, animations)
Structure: 1. CSS Variables - Colors, shadows, spacing
2. Typography - Fonts, headings, text styles 3. Content & Cards - Main content area, lesson cards 4. Sidebar - Left navigation styling 5. TOC - Right sidebar table of contents (minerva_theme.scss) 6. Navbar - Top navigation (minerva_theme.scss) 7. Responsive - Mobile-friendly breakpoints

@media (max-width: 576px) { /* Mobile phones */ }

This is handled by navbar-handler.html (no editing needed unless you want to customize behavior).





The site is fully responsive:

Desktop (>991px): Three-column layout with both sidebars
Tablet (768-991px): Sidebar becomes collapsible overlay
Mobile (<768px): Simplified layout, touch-friendly navigation

Preview on device: Find your local IP with ipconfig, then visit http://your-ip:port on your phone

title: Changelog
text:
All notable changes to the Minerva website will be documented in this file.







Comprehensive README.md - Complete guide for using and customizing the site
MAINTENANCE.md - Detailed maintenance guide with best practices
Right sidebar TOC - Table of contents now appears on the right side of lesson pages
Breadcrumb navigation - Easy way to navigate back to overview pages
Emoji icons - Visual navigation in sidebar (ğŸ“š, ğŸ“ˆ, ğŸ“, ğŸ“Š, ğŸ², ğŸ’°)
Smooth hover effects - Elegant animations on TOC and cards
Three-column layout - Left sidebar + content + right TOC





Dual stylesheet system - styles.css (main styling) + minerva_theme.scss (theme enhancements)
Improved card design - Modern, responsive cards for lessons and topics
Enhanced mobile responsiveness - Better experience on tablets and phones
Updated color scheme - Professional blue and purple palette
Refined typography - Inter font family, improved readability





Legacy code - Cleaned up old comments and unused styles
Duplicate CSS - Removed redundant styling between files
Navbar emoji animation - Removed distracting bounce effect
TODO comments - Fixed site-url placeholder





Main page layout - Removed white horizontal lines in hero section
Sidebar navigation - Subject navigation now on left, page TOC on right
Mobile sidebar - Fixed overlay behavior on small screens
TOC visibility - Resolved CSS issues preventing TOC from appearing





Added comprehensive README with setup, customization, and troubleshooting
Created maintenance guide with best practices and checklists
Documented code structure and organization
Added examples for common tasks (adding lessons, subjects, years)










Basic Quarto website structure
Year-based organization (1.g, 2.g)
Subject-based lessons
LaTeX math support
Responsive design
GitHub Pages deployment






When making significant changes, add them under a new version header:
## [X.Y.Z] - YYYY-MM-DD

### Added
- New features you added

### Changed
- Changes to existing features

### Fixed
- Bug fixes

### Removed
- Removed features
Use semantic versioning: - Major (X): Breaking changes, complete redesigns - Minor (Y): New features, no breaking changes - Patch (Z): Bug fixes, small improvements

title: ğŸ› ï¸ Minerva Maintenance Guide
text:
This guide covers common maintenance tasks, code organization, and best practices for keeping your Minerva website clean and efficient.



Code Organization
Regular Maintenance Tasks
Adding New Content Workflow
Styling Best Practices
Performance Optimization
Backup & Version Control
Common Issues & Solutions







âœ… ORGANIZED:
years/1.g/funktionir/
â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd              # Overview of functions
â”œâ”€â”€ linear-functions.qmd   # Specific topic
â”œâ”€â”€ quadratic-functions.qmd
â””â”€â”€ exponential-functions.qmd

âŒ MESSY:
years/1.g/funktionir/
â”œâ”€â”€ f1.qmd                 # Unclear names
â”œâ”€â”€ temp_backup.qmd        # Old files
â”œâ”€â”€ test123.qmd            # Test files
â””â”€â”€ copy_of_functions.qmd  # Duplicates



Files: - Use lowercase - Use hyphens for spaces: kvadratsetningar-introduktion.qmd - Be descriptive: tol-naturlig-og-heiltol.qmd not tol1.qmd - No spaces or special characters
Folders: - Lowercase - Underscores for compound names: tol_og_algebra - Short but clear: funktionir not funktiÃ³nir_og_grafikar_2024
Sidebar IDs: - Use pattern: sidebar-1g, sidebar-2g, sidebar-3g - Consistent naming makes maintenance easier











Content Type
Location
Example




Homepage
/index.qmd
Main landing page


About page
/about.qmd
Information about site


Year overview
/years/1.g/index.qmd
Year-level home


Subject overview
/years/1.g/funktionir/index.qmd
Subject home


Lesson content
/years/1.g/funktionir/lesson-name.qmd
Individual lessons


Shared components
/years/1.g/breadcrumb.html
Reusable includes


Global styles
/minerva_theme.scss
All CSS


Global scripts
/navbar-handler.html
JavaScript


Configuration
/_quarto.yml
Site settings










1. Check for Broken Links
quarto render
# Check terminal output for warnings about missing links
2. Preview on Multiple Devices - Desktop browser - Tablet view (F12 â†’ device toolbar) - Mobile phone
3. Review Recent Changes
git log --oneline --since="1 week ago"
git diff HEAD~7 HEAD



1. Update Dependencies
quarto check
# Upgrade if new version available
2. Clean Up Generated Files
# Remove and regenerate docs
rm -rf docs/
quarto render
3. Review and Clean - Remove unused images - Delete test files - Archive old content - Update outdated information
4. Performance Check - Test loading speed - Check image sizes (compress if >500KB) - Verify mobile responsiveness



1. Content Audit - Review all lessons for accuracy - Update examples and practice problems - Check that all TODOs are addressed
2. SEO & Accessibility - Verify all images have alt text - Check heading hierarchy (H1 â†’ H2 â†’ H3) - Test with screen reader if possible
3. Backup Everything
# Create full backup
git tag -a v1.0-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d) -m "Quarterly backup"
git push --tags








Create .qmd file in appropriate subject folder
Add proper frontmatter (title, sidebar, toc)
Include breadcrumb navigation
Write content with proper heading structure (##, ###)
Add to sidebar in _quarto.yml
Test locally with quarto preview
Check TOC appears on right side
Verify sidebar navigation works
Test on mobile view
Commit changes with descriptive message
Push and verify deployment

Create lessons

Use lesson template above
Consistent naming
Proper frontmatter

Test thoroughly
quarto preview
# Navigate through all new pages








Edit minerva_theme.scss when you want to: - Change colors site-wide - Adjust spacing or typography - Modify hover effects - Update responsive breakpoints - Add new component styles
Donâ€™t edit styles for: - Content-specific formatting (use Quarto markdown features) - One-off styling needs (use inline CSS in .qmd files)



The theme file is organized in sections:
/* 1. Variables - Change colors, shadows, fonts */
:root { ... }

/* 2. Base Styles - Body, typography */
body { ... }

/* 3. Components - Navbar, sidebar, TOC */
.navbar { ... }

/* 4. Layout - Grid, content area */
#quarto-content { ... }

/* 5. Responsive - Mobile breakpoints */
@media (max-width: 991px) { ... }

/* 6. Utilities - Helpers, animations */
.animate-slide-left { ... }
Add new styles at the appropriate section!



Use CSS variables for consistency:
/* âœ… GOOD - Uses variables */
.my-element {
  background: var(--minerva-primary);
  color: var(--minerva-text);
}

/* âŒ BAD - Hardcoded colors */
.my-element {
  background: #0F172A;
  color: #1F2937;
}



Always test at these breakpoints:

1200px+ - Large desktop
992px-1199px - Desktop
768px-991px - Tablet
576px-767px - Large phone
<576px - Small phone

Use mobile-first approach:
/* âœ… GOOD - Mobile first */
.element {
  font-size: 14px;
}

@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .element {
    font-size: 16px;
  }
}

/* âŒ BAD - Desktop first (harder to maintain) */
.element {
  font-size: 16px;
}

@media (max-width: 767px) {
  .element {
    font-size: 14px;
  }
}







Before adding images:

Compress images: Use TinyPNG
Resize appropriately:

Hero images: 1920x800px
Card images: 600x400px
Icons: 128x128px

Use correct format:

Photos: .jpg
Graphics/logos: .png
Icons: .svg





Keep _quarto.yml clean: - Remove commented-out sections - No duplicate entries - Proper indentation
Minimize custom JavaScript: - Current navbar-handler.html is necessary - Avoid adding more scripts unless critical



Check your site speed: 1. Build site: quarto render 2. Test: Open docs/index.html in browser 3. Check DevTools: Network tab â†’ Page load time 4. Goal: <2 seconds on 3G connection
If slow: - Compress images - Remove unused CSS - Minimize large math equations on homepage







Commit messages:
# âœ… GOOD - Clear and descriptive
git commit -m "Add quadratic equations lesson to 1.g functions"
git commit -m "Fix TOC not appearing on mobile devices"
git commit -m "Update color scheme to darker blue theme"

# âŒ BAD - Vague or unclear
git commit -m "updates"
git commit -m "fix stuff"
git commit -m "asdfasdf"
Branching strategy:
# Create feature branch
git checkout -b add-statistics-lessons

# Make changes, test thoroughly
quarto preview

# Commit and push
git add .
git commit -m "Add initial statistics lessons for 1.g"
git push origin add-statistics-lessons

# Merge when ready
git checkout main
git merge add-statistics-lessons
git push origin main



What to backup: - âœ… All .qmd files - âœ… _quarto.yml - âœ… minerva_theme.scss - âœ… Custom HTML files - âœ… Images folder - âŒ docs/ folder (auto-generated) - âŒ .quarto/ folder (cache)
Automated backups:
# Create backup script (backup.sh)
#!/bin/bash
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d)
tar -czf "backup_minerva_$DATE.tar.gz" \
  --exclude='docs' \
  --exclude='.quarto' \
  --exclude='node_modules' \
  .







Symptoms: Left sidebar missing on lesson pages
Solutions: 1. Check frontmatter has sidebar: sidebar-1g 2. Verify sidebar ID matches in _quarto.yml 3. Restart preview server 4. Clear browser cache



Symptoms: No table of contents on right side
Solutions: 1. Ensure frontmatter has: yaml    toc: true    toc-location: right 2. Check heading structure (need at least 2 ## headings) 3. Verify _quarto.yml has grid configuration 4. Check minerva_theme.scss has TOC styles



Symptoms: CSS changes donâ€™t appear in browser
Solutions: 1. Hard refresh: Ctrl + Shift + R 2. Clear browser cache completely 3. Stop and restart quarto preview 4. Check browser console for CSS errors 5. Verify no typos in minerva_theme.scss



Symptoms: 404 errors or â€œPage not foundâ€
Solutions: 1. Check file path is correct and relative 2. Use .qmd extension in links, not .html 3. Verify file exists in correct location 4. Check for typos in filename 5. Run quarto render and check for warnings



Symptoms: Content overlaps or sidebar doesnâ€™t work on mobile
Solutions: 1. Test with browser DevTools device toolbar 2. Check responsive breakpoints in CSS 3. Verify viewport meta tag (Quarto adds automatically) 4. Test on actual device, not just emulator 5. Check for hardcoded widths in custom CSS



Symptoms: LaTeX shows as plain text
Solutions: 1. Verify math: true in _quarto.yml 2. Check syntax: Use $$ for display, $ for inline 3. Escape special characters if needed 4. Test with simple equation first: $x = 5$ 5. Check browser console for KaTeX errors







User behavior: - Most visited pages - Average time on page - Mobile vs.Â desktop ratio - Popular subjects
Technical metrics: - Page load times - Broken links - Error rates - Browser compatibility



Google Analytics 4: 1. Create GA4 property 2. Get measurement ID 3. Add to _quarto.yml: yaml    website:      google-analytics: "G-XXXXXXXXXX"
Simple alternative: - Use GitHub Pages insights - Check commit history for content popularity - Monitor issues/feedback from users





Before deploying updates:

Test locally with quarto preview
Check all links work
Verify images load
Test on mobile view
Review git status for unwanted files
Run quarto render successfully
Check for render errors/warnings
Commit with clear message
Push to repository
Wait for GitHub Pages to deploy (2-5 minutes)
Visit live site and spot-check
Test critical pages on live site





When things go wrong:

Check this guide - Common issues section
Search Quarto docs - quarto.org/docs
Review error messages - Often tell you exactly whatâ€™s wrong
Check git history - What changed recently?
git log --oneline -10
git diff HEAD~1 HEAD
Ask for help - GitHub Issues or community forums

When reporting issues: - Describe what you expected - Describe what happened instead - Share error messages (copy full text) - List steps to reproduce - Mention browser/device used




Quarto: - Official Documentation - Quarto GitHub - Quarto Community
CSS & Design: - MDN Web Docs - CSS Tricks - Can I Use - Check browser support
Git: - Git Documentation - GitHub Guides




Print or save this checklist:



Commit changes with descriptive messages
Test changes in preview before committing
Check for console errors





Review recent changes
Check for broken links
Test on mobile device





Update Quarto if new version available
Clean up unused files
Review and update outdated content
Check site performance





Full content audit
Complete backup
Review analytics (if set up)
Update documentation


Keep your Minerva site clean, fast, and maintainable! ğŸš€

title: ğŸš€ Quick Start Guide for Contributors
text:
New to the Minerva project? This guide will get you up and running in 5 minutes!



Install Quarto: https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/
Clone the repository (if using Git)
Open in your text editor (VS Code recommended)






cd quarto_2_test
quarto preview
Your browser will open automatically. The site will auto-reload when you make changes!



Edit the homepage: 1. Open index.qmd 2. Change any text 3. Save the file 4. Watch the browser auto-reload âœ¨



Create a test lesson: 1. Copy an existing lesson file in years/1.g/funktionir/ 2. Rename it to my-test-lesson.qmd 3. Change the title in the frontmatter 4. Add it to _quarto.yml under the FunktiÃ³nir section






New lesson page:
# 1. Create file
years/1.g/subject-name/my-lesson.qmd

# 2. Add frontmatter:
---
title: "My Lesson"
sidebar: sidebar-1g
toc: true
toc-location: right
---

# 3. Add to _quarto.yml sidebar
New subject:
# 1. Create folder
mkdir years/1.g/new-subject

# 2. Create index.qmd in that folder

# 3. Add section to _quarto.yml sidebar



Change colors: - Edit minerva_theme.scss - Modify the :root variables at the top - Save and see changes instantly
Change fonts: - Edit the @import line in minerva_theme.scss - Update --main-font variable



# Generate the site
quarto render

# Site is created in docs/ folder
# Ready to deploy to GitHub Pages!




Important files you'll edit:
â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml          â† Site configuration & sidebars
â”œâ”€â”€ minerva_theme.scss   â† All styling
â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd            â† Homepage
â”œâ”€â”€ years/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ 1.g/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd    â† Year overview
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ subject/
â”‚           â””â”€â”€ *.qmd    â† Lesson files

Don't edit these:
â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                â† Auto-generated
â”œâ”€â”€ .quarto/             â† Cache
â””â”€â”€ navbar-handler.html  â† Works automatically

HÃ¸vuÃ°sreglur
1. Produktregla: \[

\]
2. Kvotientsregla: \[
\log\left(\frac{a}{b}\right) = \log(a) - \log(b)

3. Potensregla: \[

Serligi virÃ°i
\[

\[

\]
\[

\]
\[

DÃ¸mi
Produktregla: \[

\]
Potensregla: \[
\log(1000) = \log(10^3) = 3 \log(10) = 3 \cdot 1 = 3
\]
Kvotientsregla: \[
\log(0.1) = \log\left(\frac{1}{10}\right) = \log(1) - \log(10) = 0 - 1 = -1
\]

text:

Cosinus relatiÃ³nin (Cosinussetningin)

title: AnnuitetslÃ¡n prÃ³gv
text:
Dummy Content
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

Upphav
Vit vilja finna eitt fast gjald \(y\), sum skal betalast hvÃ¸nn termin Ã­ \(n\) terminar, so at eitt lÃ¡n \(L\) viÃ° rentu \(r\) verÃ°ur gjaldaÃ° av.


NÃºtÃ­Ã°arvirÃ°i av gjÃ¸ldum
NÃºtÃ­Ã°arvirÃ°iÃ° av Ã¸llum terminsgjÃ¸ldum skal vera lÃ­ka mikiÃ° sum lÃ¡nsupphÃ¦ddin:
\[
L = y \cdot (1+r)^{-1} + y \cdot (1+r)^{-2} + ... + y \cdot (1+r)^{-n}
\]


Geometrisk rÃ¸Ã°
Hetta er ein geometrisk rÃ¸Ã° viÃ° fyrsta limi \(y \cdot (1+r)^{-1}\) og kvotan \((1+r)^{-1}\).
Summan av geometriskari rÃ¸Ã° er:
\[
L = y \cdot (1+r)^{-1} \cdot \frac{1 - (1+r)^{-n}}{1 - (1+r)^{-1}}
\]


Einfalding
\[
L = y \cdot \frac{(1+r)^{-1} - (1+r)^{-(n+1)}}{1 - (1+r)^{-1}}
\]
\[
L = y \cdot \frac{1 - (1+r)^{-n}}{r}
\]


Loysn
\[
y = \frac{L \cdot r}{1 - (1+r)^{-n}} = \frac{L \cdot r \cdot (1+r)^n}{(1+r)^n - 1}
\]

text:
Dummy Content
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

Upphav
Vit leggja inn eitt gjald \(y\) hvÃ¸nn termin Ã­ \(n\) terminar viÃ° rentu \(r\) um termin.


FramtÃ­Ã°arvirÃ°i
Fyrsta gjaldiÃ° veksur Ã­ \(n\) terminar: \[
y \cdot (1+r)^{n}
\]
AnnaÃ° gjaldiÃ° veksur Ã­ \((n-1)\) terminar: \[
y \cdot (1+r)^{n-1}
\]
SÃ­Ã°sta gjaldiÃ° veksur Ã­ 1 termin: \[
y \cdot (1+r)^{1}
\]


Samanlagt
\[
K_n = y \cdot (1+r) + y \cdot (1+r)^2 + ... + y \cdot (1+r)^n
\]


Geometrisk rÃ¸Ã°
Hetta er ein geometrisk rÃ¸Ã° viÃ° fyrsta limi \(y \cdot (1+r)\) og kvotan \((1+r)\).
\[
K_n = y \cdot (1+r) \cdot \frac{(1+r)^n - 1}{(1+r) - 1}
\]


Einfalding
\[
K_n = y \cdot (1+r) \cdot \frac{(1+r)^n - 1}{r}
\]
Ella meira einfalt:
\[
K_n = y \cdot \frac{(1+r)^{n+1} - (1+r)}{r} = y \cdot \frac{(1+r)^n - 1}{r} \cdot (1+r)
\]
Men ofta brÃºkt forma er:
\[
K_n = y \cdot \frac{(1+r)^n - 1}{r}
\]
